page.title: 05HODNET CHURCH (St Lukes)
page.content: Hodnet Church is very large and roomy. It has{an octagonal tower}one of only 2 in England. It is made of{red sand {stone.}It has two altars but they only use the one. There are five stained glass windows and they look beautiful. It has lots of brass and is kept shiny. There is a Flower Rota. It's for people to put their name on to bring flowers to decorate the church. The oldest part of the church is by the door. Also there are windows dating back to{Norman times (1066). They are above the Gothic windows. You can still see the original Norman arches. It has two naves and a private chapel for the{Heber Percys. }It has quite a few pews and a vestry where the choir get changed into their robes. The church has a choir of about twenty people. Kathryn Mills aged 10.
